Chess.title: Chess Rules
rules: Board Set Up: Arrange pieces on the first row from left to right: rook, knight, bishop, queen (on matching color square), king, bishop, knight, rook; pawns fill the second row.

Piece movement: *Pawns move forward one square (two on first move), capture diagonally, and promote on reaching the opposite side. *Rooks move any squares horizontally or vertically. *Knights move in an L-shape (two squares one way, one perpendicular) and jump over pieces. *Bishops move any squares diagonally. *Queens move any squares in straight or diagonal lines.*Kings move one square any direction but cannot enter checkEach player will get limited time per game
Special Move: Castling lets the king move two squares toward a rook
Checks and wins: *Say 'check' when attacking the king; opponent must escape. *Checkmate ends the game when the king is in check with no escape. *Draws occur via stalemate

Rules at RC: *White begins with the clock running after setup. *Each side starts with 15 minutes total on their clock. *No increments time unless specified in begining *After each move, the player presses their clock to switch time to the opponent. *The player who runs out of time first loses, unless they have checkmated the opponent earlier.
